Accelerate Development.text: Play this card after a new card is placed in the development pool. Place this card on top of any card in the development pool, with your player token on it. Other players may not take the chosen from the development pool. On your next turn, you must take the chosen card.

Policy Initiative.text:
To play this card, pay 1 prosperity.

Play this card when taking a card from the development pool. Take two cards instead of one.

New Ideas.text: Play this card before you develop. Discard any number of cards from the development pool, and replace them with new cards from the top of the deck.

Research Grants.text:
To play this card, remove a [[C]] from a policy or institution.

Take a technology from the auction pool OR search the development deck for a technology that has already been discovered.

New Administration.text:
To play this card, pay 1 prosperity. You may forgo this cost if you have a Republic and your prosperity is 5 or greater.

Discard up to four admin cards. Draw that many admin cards, plus one.

Free Enterprise.text:
To play this card, remove a [[C]] from a policy or institution, or move a [[C]] from a Financial Institution to a Stock Exchange.

If you have a Command Economy or State Ownership policy, you cannot play this card.

Take a Commercial Infrastructure, Financial Institution, Stock Exchange, or Hospitals card from the dev pool.

Seize Production.text:
To play this card, pay 1 prosperity and remove [[P]] from your industry policy.

Build a factory OR draw a military card

Five-Year Plan.text:
To play this card, pay 2 prosperity, remove [[P]] from your industry policy, and sacrifice a pop.

Build two factories.

Establish Trade Route.text:
Overseas Trade: Place one of your trade tokens on an overseas trade route. You gain the benefits of the trade route until your token is removed.

OR

Trade Agreement: Place one of your trade tokens on another player's trade zone, and they do the same in your trade zone. You and that player each gain +1[[C]] per turn as long as you control connected urban provinces.

Urbanization.text: Move up to 2 citizens from a countryside province to an adjacent city province you control. Then move up to two peasants in a city onto factories or urban centers.

Conscription.text: To play this card, pay X prosperity. Take X Standing Army cards from the development pool.

Propaganda Campaign.text:
To play this card, remove a [[C]] from a policy or institution.

Convert a pop.

If you cannot pay the prosperity cost for another card, you may discard this card instead.

Expansionism.text:
To play this card, pay 1 prosperity.

Settle: Move a pop from a countryside province you control to an adjacent countryside province (you don't need to control it).

OR

Cleanse: Remove up to two pops from a province where you have a regiment.

OR

Conquest: Choose a neutral province, and discard X military cards, where X is 1 + the number of neutral regiments in the province. Remove the neutral regiments. You may move a regiment from an adjacent province into that province to occupy it.

Diplomatic Action.text:
Retaliate: Play this card when another player interrupts your trade or cleanses your pops. Declare war on that player.

OR

Conquest: Choose a neutral province, and discard X military cards, where X is 1 + the number of neutral regiments in the province. Remove the neutral regiments. You may move a regiment from an adjacent province into that province to occupy it.

OR

Trade Technology: Choose a willing player. You each may discover a technology that the other has discovered.

Espionage.text:
To play this card, remove a [[C]] from a policy or institution.

Steal Technology: Choose a player. Take all technologies in the auction pool that have been discovered by that player.

OR

Sabotage: Remove up to three production or food from a single card belonging to another player.

OR

Support Rebellion: Choose a province in which the majority of pops are occupied. The occupying player may discard a number of military cards equal to the difference between the number of occupied and non-occupied pops in the province. If they don't remove the occupying regiment from the board.
